p: The second higher-level circulation feature that is influencing the WAM is the Tropical Easterly Jet (TEJ) located at a height around 150–200 hPa. In contrast to the AEJ, the TEJ does not influence the total Sahel rainfall amount by its latitudinal position (Fig. S 3), but rather by its strength (Fig. 2e). The convective precipitation is again more sensitive to differences in the TEJ than the large-scale fraction (Fig. 2f). We find a significant correlation between a stronger TEJ and associated larger Sahel convective rainfall.
